scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers of Sidney Gross include scrapbooks, art works, writings, exhibition catalogs, and a biographical outline.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reel N70-56: Writings, on the philosophical and psychological implications of art and aesthetics, color theories, artistic techniques, and, generally, the history of art; drawings; exhibition catalogs; clippings; and a few miscellaneous items.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reel N70-61: A biographical outline; lecture notes kept by one of his students; scrapbooks containing clippings and notices of Gross's shows; and ten letters to Francis Taylor, Gross's former high school art teacher, 1939-1950.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels N70-56 and N70-61 available at Archives of American Art and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals returned to the lender, Mrs. Sidney Gross, after microfilming.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Painter, writer; New York, N.Y. Produced primarily abstract paintings.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The lender is the widow of Sidney Gross.
